title: section 44 of the Mother and Baby Institutions Payment Scheme Act 2023 (No.
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Mother and Baby Institutions
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Mother and Baby Institutions 
Payment Scheme Act 2023 (Financial support in respect of legal costs and 
expenses) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 20 March 2024. 

Interpretation

title: section 44 of the Mother and Baby Institutions Payment Scheme Act 2023 (No.
heading: 3. (1) An applicant or a person to whom section 39(3) of the Act of 2023
text_raw:
3. (1) An applicant or a person to whom section 39(3) of the Act of 2023 
applies, may apply to the Scheme for the provision of support towards legal 
costs incurred following consultation with a legal practitioner for the purpose 
of: 

(a) 

providing an affidavit for the purposes of establishing or 
verifying an applicant’s residence in a relevant institution; or 

(b) 

their decision to accept or reject an offer under the Scheme. 

(2) The applicant or a person to whom section 39(3) of the Act of 2023 
applies, shall submit an invoice or proof of payment to support his or her 
application and this shall include the following information: 

(a) 

the applicant’s name; 

(b) where applicable, the name of the person to whom section 39(3) 

of the Act of 2023 applies; 

(c) 

(d) 

the Application Reference Number provided by the Scheme in 
relation to the application concerned; 

confirmation that the costs were incurred in accordance with 
Regulation 3(1). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th March, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [88] 3 

(3) The Scheme shall consider the application and, if satisfied that the legal 
cost has been incurred in accordance with Regulation 3(1), shall make payment 
directly to the applicant or, where applicable, the person to whom section 39(3) 
of the Act of 2023 applies.

title: section 44 of the Mother and Baby Institutions Payment Scheme Act 2023 (No.
heading: 4. (1) The amount of financial support which may be provided to facilitate
text_raw:
4. (1) The amount of financial support which may be provided to facilitate 
legal assistance in accordance with Regulation 3(1)(a) shall be the amount 
charged by the legal practitioner in respect of that legal assistance up to a limit 
of €200. 

(2) The amount of financial support which may be provided to facilitate 
seeking independent legal advice in accordance with Regulation 3(1)(b) shall 
be the amount charged by the legal practitioner in respect of that legal advice 
up to a limit of €500 plus the amount of VAT in respect of this amount. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 March, 2024. 

RODERIC O’GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth.
